Description: Fragment of a limestone stela; three lines of Hieroglyphic text above a representation of a woman before an offering-table and holding a mirror and towel.
Curator's comments: Published: IES Edwards, JEA XXIII, p.165. Un Arte per la Belleza, (Padua 1984), p. 50 [60] = Un Arte per la Belleza, (Lugano 1984), p. 50 [113]. Stead, Egyptian Life, (1986), p.53, Fig. 72. Ward, Essays on Feminine Titles of the Middle Kingdom, (Beirut, 1986), p.29. Manniche, An Ancient Egyptian Herbal, (1989), p.45 (photo). Bradley and Middleton, Provenancing (1989), p.477.
